result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monti L Cooper

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant Monti L Cooper in court. Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing 12/1/2022
Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Dennis P Moroney on 10/17/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witnesses A & B/ Bosco's Social Club (or its employees)  listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:52 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Monti L Cooper in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Monti L Cooper. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
